ygData.subject: Re: Enchanter Nerf Protest.
ygData.msgSnippet: Um, all ultravision does is let you see near-perfect in the dark.  IT does NOT let you see invisible. Start a DE char, and test it if you don t believe me.
ygData.messageBody:
Um, all ultravision does is let you see near-perfect in the dark. IT does
NOT let you see invisible.

Start a DE char, and test it if you don't believe me.

Eari

----- Original Message -----
From: Wanderer CommonWealth <wanderercw@...>
To: <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, May 21, 1999 1:49 AM
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Enchanter Nerf Protest.


> From: Wanderer CommonWealth <wanderercw@...>
>
> OH OH! I GOT AN IDEA!
> We Can have a Running Marathon to show that we are all
> determined enchanter's. We should choose 1 server and
> all enchanters from all servers (If diffrent make a
> new lvl 1 enchanter) and run from Erudin all the way
> to The Other End of Felwith to Show our determination.
> hehe now that would be Fun and would help our cause.
> The Wanderer
> *Wander*
>
> --- osmosis <osmosis@...> wrote:
> > From: osmosis <osmosis@...>
> >
> > At 04:11 PM 5/19/99 -0500, you wrote:
> > >From: "Hapke, Matthew" <mahapke@...>
> > >
> > >Verant Guy #1: Hmm, sure is quiet in here.
> > >Verant Guy #2: Yeah, all the enchanters are
> > protesting by not playing.
> > >Verant Guy #1: Really? We'll have to thank them
> > later. Look! The
> > >feedback list is cut in half today. You sure this
> > isnt' a holiday?
> >
> > Exactly. This is the opposite of what we need to
> > do, although I could be
> > wrong. It seems as though they are working through
> > improving the classes
> > by way of taking the most used classes first and
> > saving the least used ones
> > last. Think of how many /petitions they would get
> > if the major Wizard bomb
> > spell wasnt working! Or if Spirit of the Wind
> > suddenly worked like Fear.
> > Give them time... I think the thing we must remember
> > is BALANCE... they
> > must BALANCE the classes, and I'm sure they are
> > aware of this and know what
> > they're doing. Hell, they MADE the game... i'm sure
> > they will FIX it
> >
> >
> >
